text: Lead carbonate is a compound composed of lead and carbonate ions. It contains lead in the +2 oxidation state. It is made by mixing lead(II) acetate and carbon dioxide. It does not dissolve in water. It is poisonous because it has lead in it. It produces lead(II) oxide when heated. ==Related pages== *Lead(IV) oxide *Lead nitrate *Lead Category:Lead compounds Category:Carbonates
title: Lead carbonate
